rich-page.field:
Setup Guide

External Dependencies

Extensions

The following Extensions are already installed as a part of this Computer System Validation (CSV) template.

FMC Work Item Save

This extension is used for calculating and setting the "Tool - Tool Confidence Level" custom field value.
It is preconfigured in the template.

Additional information and documentation can be found on the Extension's Site and in the Extension's readme file.

Module description, usage and customization guide:  

  • WorkItemSave - Provides a way to execute scripts before or after saving a Work Item.
    • Module ID: workItemFactoryInterceptorFactory
    • Restrictions: None - Works with all Work Item types.
    • Usage: Loads scripts stored in <Polarion Installation>/scripts/workitemsave/ based on their file names.
      • projectId-workitemType-pre/post-save.js
      • workitemType-pre/post-save.js
      • projectId-pre/post-save.js
      • pre/post-save.js
    • The CSV template currently uses:
      • workitemsave\tool-pre-save.js - This script is used to determine the "Tool Confidence Level" of the   workitem-type tool false true false true false true true _top Work Item type.

VelocityForm

This extension allows users to load a Velocity script in the Form Extension.

It is currently preconfigured for  workitem-type toolchain false true false true true true true _top , workitem-type tool false true false true false true true _top , workitem-type metConfidenceFromUse false true false true true true true _top , workitem-type metEvaluationOfDevelopment false true false true true true true _top , workitem-type metValidationOfTool false true false true true true true _top and workitem-type metDevelopmentWithStandard false true false true true true true _top Work Item types and is used for the TQK Traceability Table and Advanced Information Form Extension panels.

Module description, usage and customization guide:  

  • VelocityForm - Renders a Script Extension block with a Velocity script from a file as its content.
    • Module ID: velocity_form
    • Restrictions: None - Works with all Work Item types.
    • Usage: Requires an additional script attribute containing the Velocity script file name stored in <Polarion Installation>/scripts/
      • <extension id="velocity_form" label="Hello World" script="hello-world.vm”/>
    • CSV template currently uses:
      • CSV_method_CfU_advancedInformation.vm
      • CSV_method_DwS_advancedInformation.vm
      • CSV_method_EoD_advancedInformation.vm
      • CSV_method_VoT_advancedInformation.vm
      • CSV_tool_advancedInformation.vm
      • CSV_tool_traceability.vm
      • CSV_toolchain_advancedInformation.vm

Script Functions/Conditions

This template utilizes some externally deployed ScriptFunctions, that assist with CSV processes.

All scripts are preconfigured in the template.

To deploy custom scripts:

  • Copy all files to the <Polarion Installation>/scripts/  folder.
  • Use Workflow (Administration Work Items  Workflow) to assign the scripts to Actions.

The CSV template currently uses:

  • CSV_condition_qualificationReport_verified.js - This condition is called when trying to change the status of    workitem-type toolchain false true false true true true true _top ,    workitem-type tool false true false true false true true _top ,    workitem-type metConfidenceFromUse false true false true true true true _top ,    workitem-type metEvaluationOfDevelopment false true false true true true true _top ,  workitem-type metValidationOfTool false true false true true true true _top  or    workitem-type   metDevelopmentWithStandard   false   true   false   true   true   true               true   _top     to status verified false true false true true true true _top .
    • It checks to see if the Qualification Report linked to the Work Item is in the "Verified" state.
  • CSV_condition_testRun_verified.js - This condition is called when trying to change the status of  workitem-type metValidationOfTool false true false true true true true _top to  metValidationOfTool status verified false true false true true true true _top .
    • It checks to see if the Test Run linked to the Work Item is in the metValidationOfTool status verified false true false true true true true _top state.
  • CSV_createBaseline.js - This script is called when changing the status of    workitem-type   toolchain   false   true   false   true   true   true   true   _top     ,    workitem-type   tool   false   true   false   true   false true   true   _top     ,  workitem-type metConfidenceFromUse false true false true true true true _top ,  workitem-type metEvaluationOfDevelopment false true false true true true true _top ,  workitem-type metValidationOfTool false true false true true true true _top  or  workitem-type metDevelopmentWithStandard false true false true true true true _top  to status verified false true false true true true true _top .
    • It automatically creates a Baseline on the current revision.  
      (Useful for reviewing the current state of the qualification after verifying the Work Item.) 
  • CSV_method_CfU/DwS/EoD_reuseDocumentScript.js - This script is called when a new     workitem-type     metConfidenceFromUse     false     true     false     true     true     true     true     _top         ,    workitem-type     metEvaluationOfDevelopment     false     true     false     true     true     true   true     _top         or    workitem-type     metDevelopmentWithStandard     false     true     false     true     true     true                 true     _top         Work Item is created.
    • It reuses an existing Report or template to create and link a new  documents/document-type qualification_documentation false true false true true true true _top Report to the Work Item.
  • CSV_method_VoT_reuseDocumentScript.js - This script is called when a new  workitem-type metValidationOfTool false true false true true true true _top  Work Item is created.
    • It reuses an existing Report or template to create and link a new  documents/document-type qualification_documentation false true false true true true true _top  Report to the Work Item.
    • It takes an existing  documents/document-type test_case_specification false true false true true true true _top or creates a new one from a template and links it to the Work Item.
    • It creates a  testing/testrun-type manual false true false true true true true _top Test Run configured to execute all  workitem-type testcase false true false true true true true s _top from the documents/document-type test_case_specification false true false true true true true _top Document that are linked to the workitem-type usecase false true false true true true true s _top from the  documents/document-type use_case_specification false true false true true true true _top Document that is linked to the workitem-type metValidationOfTool false true false true true true true 's _top parent     workitem-type     tool     false     true     false     true     false     true     true     _top           Work Item.
  • CSV_tool_reuseDocumentScript.js - This script is called when a new  workitem-type tool false true false true false true true _top Work Item is created.
    • It reuses an existing Report or template to create and link a new    documents/document-type   qualification_documentation   false   true false   true   true   true   true   _top      Report to the Work Item.
    • It takes an existing  documents/document-type use_case_specification false true false true true true true _top  or creates a new one from a template and links it to the Work Item.
  • CSV_toolchain_reuseDocumentScript.js - This script is called when a new  workitem-type toolchain false true false true false true true _top Work Item is created.
    • It uses a template to create a new    documents/document-type   qualification_documentation   false   true false   true   true   true   true   _top      Report and links it to the Work Item.

CSV Enumerations

This template uses several custom Enumerations for the Custom Fields of some Work Item types.

All custom Enumerations are preconfigured in the template.

Global custom Enumerations are as follows:

  • RPL - asil-enum.xml - Used to identify the Risk Priority Level.
    • Name: asil
    • Options: asil 1 false true false true true true true _top |  asil 2 false true false true true true true _top |  asil 3 false true false true true true true _top |  asil 4 false true false true true true true _top
  • Environment - environment-enum.xml - Used to identify the platform that the software tool's qualification is executed on.
    • Name: environment
    • Options:  environment linux false true false true true true true _top | environment macOS false true false true true true true _top | environment windows false true false true true true true _top | environment other false true false true true true true _top
  • Tool Confidence Level - toolconfidencelevel-enum.xml - Used to identify the confidence level of the software tool.
    • Name: toolconfidencelevel
    • Options: toolconfidencelevel tcl1 false true false true true true true _top | toolconfidencelevel tcl2 false true false true true true true _top | toolconfidencelevel tcl3 false true false true true true true _top

Type specific Enumerations are:

  • Tool - Tool Error Detection - tool-toolerrordetection-enum.xml - Displays the level of confidence that the target software tool will not malfunction and produce erroneous output and detect that a malfunction has occured if it does.
    • Name: toolerrordetection
    • Options:  tool toolerrordetection td1 false true false true true true true _top |  tool toolerrordetection td2 false true false true true true true _top | tool toolerrordetection td3 false true false true true true true _top
  • Tool - Tool Impact - tool-toolimpact-enum.xml - Used to determine the possibility that a malfunction of the software tool can introduce, or fail to detect, errors in the safety-related item it is being used to develop.
    • Name: toolimpact
    • Options:  tool toolimpact ti1 false true false true true true true _top |  tool toolimpact ti2 false true false true true true true _top
  • Tool - Tool Type - tool-tooltype-enum.xml - Identifies the Tool's type.
    • Name: tooltype
    • Options:  tool tooltype standaloneTool false true false true true true true _top |  tool tooltype toolFunction false true false true true true true _top
  • Use Case - Subtype - usecase-subtype-enum.xml - Identifies the type of Use Case.
    • Name: subtype
    • Options:  usecase subtype general false true false true true true true _top |  usecase subtype functional false true false true true true true _top | usecase subtype technical false true false true true true true _top
  • Information - Compliance - information-compliance-enum.xml - States if the Information is valid for use in the Qualification.
    • Name: compliance
    • Options:  information compliance comply false true false true true true true _top |  information compliance partialy false true false true true true true _top | information compliance notComply false true false true true true true _top

To set up a Custom Enumeration:

  • Go to Administration: Work Items -> Enumerations.
  • At the bottom of the page, click Create new configuration.
  • Select the Unspecific Work Item Type and Custom Enumeration.
  • Enter the name of the new Enumeration and click Next.
  • Fill in Enumeration Options and click Save.

To edit an Enumeration:

  • Go to Administration Work Items   Enumerations.
  • Click Edit on the selected Enumeration row.
  • Add/Delete/Edit Enumeration Options and click Save.

Migration Steps

Follow the steps below to ensure a smooth and successful migration of the CSV project to another environment.

  1. Install Polarion on the target machine.
  2. Follow the installation guide located in the INSTALL.txt file in the CSV Template distribution archive.
    • If you modified any scripts located in <Source Polarion Installation Folder>\scripts\, use them instead of the default scripts from the CSV Template distribution.
    • If you altered or added any extensions located in <Source Polarion Installation Folder>\polarion\extensions\, use them instead of the default extensions from the CSV Template distribution.
    • If you altered or added any velocity widgets located in <Source Polarion SVN repository>\.polarion\pages\widgets\, use them instead of the default widgets from the CSV Template distribution.
  3. Export the Project folder containing the CSV project files from its SVN repository.
  4. Delete all Baselines from <Source Polarion SVN repository>\.polarion\tracker\baselines\ (Baselines cannot be exported, because they will not match the revisions in the target SVN repository.)
  5. Import the folder into the new installation's SVN repository.
  6. If you altered the Global configuration of the Polarion installation that housed your CSV project, (found within the export folder at: <Source Polarion SVN repository>\.polarion\),  import it into the new SVN repository. Commit the changes and overwrite the files in the new repository. 
  7. Restart the new target Polarion installation.
